EVJ.A: The global maximum heat value is {0.99}.

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value for label Affordability on the y-axis?

EVJ.Q: What is the maximum heat value of label Appraisal on the x-axis?

SC.Q: What is the average heat value for label Inventory on the y-axis?

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Development and Affordability or the cell corresponding to Construction and Condition?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Construction} and {Condition} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to REITs and Affordability or the cell corresponding to Property Management and Condition?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Property Management} and {Condition} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.34 to 0.47?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Commercial, Affordability), (Property Management, Age), (Appraisal, Condition), (Residential, Demand), (Mortgages, Interest Rates), (Property Management, Inventory), (Property Management, Location), (Construction, Price), (Development, Price), (Industrial, Price), (Appraisal, Supply), (Development, Supply)}.
